topics.body:
I'm not insulting anyone here or such, but I had a interesting thought: dumb people worship logic like a religion cause they don't know enough about what they are arguing about to form a educated opinion on so therefore they have to fall back on logic in order to sound intelligent.

What I mean by this is that the people who go "well logic says-", "well I'm being more logical so therefore I'm right-", etc are legitimately dumb people because they are willingly admitting that they do not know anything about what they are arguing about so they are resorting to trying to sound smart in order to argue.

To use an analogy look at back when the Large Hadron Collider was created; people were arguing that it would destroy the earth and saying it would create a black hole that would destroy the earth.  The physicists kept explaining to them that if a black hole was created the micro black hole would only exist for a couple hundred atto seconds, but the idiots heard the word "micro black hole" and thought that meant planet earth destroying.

The thing is though that the existence of paradoxes means that human logic is flawed and that physics often flies head first into the face of logic.

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5574c4866368726c7e0003d0#post_5574c4866368726c7e0003d0
The answer is that "direct action" depends on the tolerance and/or connivance of the police, military, and/or judicial system. In Weimar Germany, nationalists had all three - mostly relics of the Wilhelmine government - on their side. Denazification reversed this. Today in Europe, antifas can beat up their opponents with a wink and a nod from the authorities, whereas neo-Nazis get the book thrown at them. 

The answer: duh. Don't be a neo-Nazi.

If the scientists said it would only appear for atto seconds then go bye bye, they know much more about what their talking about, so I would assume that would make it the correct logic.

Also how much damage would a micro black hole do in that time. Its still a black hole.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5574c42e6368726c7e000380#post_5574c42e6368726c7e000380
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5574c3f16368725d7b000aa7#post_5574c3f16368725d7b000aa7
Knowledge is revelatory. Not reasoned.
Basically memes shape what we think. [/bq]
I think that's why it's so hard for so many people to understand science or such, because if you rely on what you already know to understand things such as physics you're going to have a hard time building that knowledge on top of what you already understand.

Often times science runs counter-intuitive to what logic what say so if you worship logic above all else you won't be able to understand anything.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5574c4c86368725a280005ba#post_5574c4c86368725a280005ba
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5574c3f16368725d7b000aa7#post_5574c3f16368725d7b000aa7
It sounds more like their worshiping incorrect logic.

If the scientists said it would only appear for atto seconds then go bye bye, they know much more about what their talking about, so I would assume that would make it the correct logic.

Also how much damage would a micro black hole do in that time. Its still a black hole.[/bq]
You're incorrect about the wrong logic thing.  Sub-atomic physics literally does not make any logic.

The reason why nobody still fully understands quantum physics is that it's so foreign to how we understand the world that it's like stepping into another universe with completely different set of rules where bananas fly in the air with wings like birds and you can only breath in space and not in oxygen.

Logic has no place at all in sub-atomic physics.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
